Bush Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. But he had no regrets about his leadership of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan-- the latter now nearing its 10th anniversary. He refused to echo the regrets of

House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi , D-Calif., who stood by Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital bed when her left eye fluttered open. Her right eye was damaged and is still bandaged. Kirsten Gillibrand said the congresswomen were telling Gabrielle Giffords how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength. And then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do after she got better. Gabrielle Giffords was gripping their hands, Kirsten Gillibrand said, "and the more we joked about what we were going to do, she started to open her eyes." Debbie Wasserman Schultz said she
